info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 11:20PM CDT until July 30 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Omaha/Valley NE
info.description:
Heavy rain in Woodbury and Ida counties, and additional upstream counties, will cause elevated river levels downstream.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of Iowa, including the following counties, Harrison and Monona and east central Nebraska, including the following county, Burt.
* WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams due to heavy rain upstream.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Fork Ditch, Maple Creek, Monona Harrison Ditch, Little Sioux River, and the Soldier River. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Onawa, Mapleton, Little Sioux, Castana, Turin, Rodney, Kennebec and Little Sioux Scout Ranch.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT WEDNESDAY

area.areaDesc: Harrison, IA; Monona, IA; Burt, NE
